Module: video_metadata_reader

Reads video metadata needed for EDL. reel, timecode, fps. If those fields are not present in the metadata associated with the media file the attributes in the resulting json is replaced with "NA".

Author:
  • Pietro Passarelli
Source:
  • interactive_transcription_generator/video_metadata_reader/index.js, line 1
Examples

Example usage

 var metadataReader = require('./index.js');
 var sampleVideo = "sampleVideo.mov";

  metadataReader.read({
    file: sampleVideo,
    ffprobePath: exampleFfprobePath,
    callback: function(resp){
      console.log(JSON.stringify(resp));
    }
  });

Example output from `readVideoMetadataForEDL`

{ 
   filePathName: '/some_file_path/Bowman.mov',
  date: '2016-02-18 16:38:20',
  reelName: 'time',
  timecode: '00:01:18:56',
  fps: '1/60000',
  duration: 2287.285 
}

  • module:fluent-ffmpeg
  • module:path
